post.title: H2O Model Deserialization RCE
post.content:
Summary

H2O deserializes POJO models without any filtering, potentially allowing execution of malicious code

Component

h2o-core

Affected versions

(,)

Description

The H2O machine learning platform uses serialized Java objects (POJOs) as its pretrained model format. When a model is deserialized, any class is allowed to be deserialized (no class whitelist). An attacker can construct a crafted model that uses Java gadgets and leads to arbitrary code execution when imported to the H2O platform.

PoC

An appropriate malicious POJO-based model can be created with the ysoserial tool, using the CommonsBeanutils1 payload.

Loading the model using the Web UI's "Import Model" command (or an equivalent API) will trigger code execution

Vulnerability Mitigations

No mitigations are supplied for this issue

References

No references are supplied for this issue
post.description: CVE-2024-6960, HIGH, H2O Model Deserialization RCE
